channel.title: Some Questions About Making A Client
channel.description:
1. if i download a client, will the starting place and everything be the same as my source or do i have to code it all again?..
2. if i am on a client and praying against someone who isent on it will the pray work or not?
3. Well i added armadyl/bandos armour into my source if i download a client and use it, will i still have that armour in?
4. if i download a client is it like downloading a whole new source like start coding all over again and shit?...
Please i've been wondering about those questions for a while help me if u could =)

item.title: Some Questions About Making A Client
item.dc:creator: @Scarr Scarr
item.description:
@Scarr wrote:

Sure, unblock me so I can talk to you lol.

EDIT: Your welcome =p.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Questions About Making A Client

item.title: Some Questions About Making A Client
item.dc:creator: @pistolse pistolse
item.description:
@pistolse wrote:

Scarr, u are finaly on lmfao, can u help me now as u said u was with this client i can’t get on i added ur msn but have to add me back and btw

can i just C+P Something so it will be exacly the same as mine old serv like Commands/items and that shit

Read full topic
item.source: Some Questions About Making A Client

item.title: Some Questions About Making A Client
item.dc:creator: @Scarr Scarr
item.description:
@Scarr wrote:

  1. Yes, it will be the same as your source.

  2. Only the Head Icons, you have to have working prayer on your server for it to work fully.

  3. Depends on if the client supports those items.

  4. No, it’s not.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Questions About Making A Client

item.title: Some Questions About Making A Client
item.dc:creator: @skiller_noob1 skiller noob1
item.description:
@skiller_noob1 wrote:

If the client is an open source the source will be the same, and no you will not have to ‘re-code’ anything.
And you can use Prayer aginst someone that is not on the client. As long as the source has the client will have it.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Questions About Making A Client
